Epidemiology

Epidemiology Research

Understanding disease patterns and developing interventions to improve public health

Research Focus

My epidemiology research focuses on investigating the distribution and determinants of health-related states in populations, and applying this knowledge to control health problems. I employ innovative methodological approaches to address complex public health challenges.

Infectious Disease

Modeling transmission dynamics and evaluating control measures for infectious diseases in diverse populations.

Learn more →

Environmental Health

Assessing the health impacts of environmental exposures and climate change on vulnerable populations.

Learn more →

Health Disparities

Investigating social determinants of health and developing interventions to reduce health inequities.

Learn more →

Infectious Disease Epidemiology

My work in infectious disease epidemiology combines field investigations, statistical modeling, and molecular methods to understand disease transmission and guide public health interventions.

Spatial-Temporal Analysis of Disease Outbreaks

Developed advanced methods for detecting and characterizing disease clusters and mapping transmission patterns in real-time.

  • GIS-based surveillance systems for early outbreak detection
  • Mathematical models of disease spread incorporating human mobility data
  • Real-time risk mapping for resource allocation during outbreaks

Vaccine Effectiveness Studies

Conducted large-scale observational studies to evaluate vaccine effectiveness in diverse populations and settings.

  • Test-negative design studies in multiple countries
  • Assessment of direct and indirect vaccine effects
  • Monitoring of waning immunity and breakthrough infections

Environmental Epidemiology

Investigating the relationships between environmental exposures and human health, with a focus on climate change impacts and environmental justice.

Climate Change and Health Outcomes

Examining the health impacts of extreme weather events, changing disease patterns, and air quality issues related to climate change.

  • Time-series analyses of temperature effects on mortality and morbidity
  • Projection models for future health impacts under different climate scenarios
  • Development of early warning systems and adaptation strategies

Air Pollution and Respiratory Health

Evaluating the effects of ambient and indoor air pollution on respiratory outcomes across the life course.

  • Birth cohort studies of early life exposure and respiratory development
  • Assessment of acute and chronic effects of air pollution
  • Interventions to reduce exposure in high-risk communities

Health Disparities Research

Addressing systematic differences in health outcomes among different populations to promote health equity and social justice.

Social Determinants of Health

Investigating how socioeconomic factors, education, neighborhood conditions, and access to resources influence health outcomes.

  • Multilevel modeling approaches to disentangle individual and contextual effects
  • Life course perspectives on accumulation of health risks
  • Mixed-methods research combining quantitative and qualitative approaches

Community-Based Participatory Research

Engaging communities as partners in research to address health priorities and develop culturally appropriate interventions.

  • Collaborative development of research questions and methods
  • Capacity building within underserved communities
  • Translation of findings into sustainable community programs

Collaboration Opportunities

I welcome opportunities to collaborate on epidemiological research projects that address pressing public health challenges. If you're interested in working together, please contact me to discuss potential collaborations.
